case_vignette: A 45-year-old man presents to the physician because of a 1-day history of progressive pain and blurry vision in his right eye. He is struggling to open this eye because of the pain. His left eye is asymptomatic. He wears contact lenses. He has bronchial asthma treated with inhaled salbutamol. He works as a kindergarten teacher. The vital signs include: temperature 37.0°C (98.6°F), pulse 85/min, and blood pressure 135/75 mm Hg. The examination shows a visual acuity in the left eye of 20/25 and the ability to count fingers at 3 feet in the right eye. A photograph of the right eye is shown.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I'm experiencing a lot of pain in my right eye, it's gotten blurry, and it's really tough to open it because it hurts.
What is your age and sex?
I'm a 45-year-old man.
Do you have any past medical history or take any medications regularly?
Yes, I have bronchial asthma and I use an inhaler for it.
Do you have any family history of eye conditions or autoimmune diseases?
I'm sorry, but I don't have information about my family history regarding eye conditions or autoimmune diseases.
I understand. Have you had any recent injury or trauma to your right eye?
No, I haven't had any injury or trauma to my right eye.
**Final Diagnosis:** Acute angle-closure glaucoma
